description:
ICON - is a modeling framework for weather, climate, and environmental
prediction. It solves the full three-dimensional non-hydrostatic and
compressible Navier-Stokes equations on an icosahedral grid and allows
seamless predictions from local to global scales.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
BLIS is a portable software framework for instantiating high-performance
BLAS-like dense linear algebra libraries. The framework was designed to
isolate essential kernels of computation that, when optimized,
immediately enable optimized implementations of most of its commonly
used and computationally intensive operations. BLIS is written in ISO
C99 and available under a new/modified/3-clause BSD license. While BLIS
exports a new BLAS-like API, it also includes a BLAS compatibility layer
which gives application developers access to BLIS implementations via
traditional BLAS routine calls. An object-based API unique to BLIS is
also available.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: eccodes
dependencies.description:
ecCodes is a package developed by ECMWF for processing meteorological
data in GRIB (1/2), BUFR (3/4) and GTS header formats.

dependencies.name: findutils
dependencies.description:
The GNU Find Utilities are the basic directory searching utilities of
the GNU operating system.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software, generic shared ATLAS is an
approach for the automatic generation and optimization of numerical
software. Currently ATLAS supplies optimized versions for the complete
set of linear algebra kernels known as the Basic Linear Algebra
Subroutines (BLAS), and a subset of the linear algebra routines in the
LAPACK library.

dependencies.name: libfyaml
dependencies.description:
Fully feature complete YAML parser and emitter, supporting the latest
YAML spec and passing the full YAML testsuite.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MVAPICH2-X is the advanced version of the MVAPICH2 MPI library with
enhanced features (UMR, ODP, DC, Core-Direct, SHARP, XPMEM), OSU INAM
(InifniBand Network Monitoring and Analysis),PGAS (OpenSHMEM, UPC,
UPC++, and CAF), and MPI+PGAS programming models with unified
communication runtime. MVAPICH2-X is not installable from source and is
only available through a binary mirror. If you do not find the binary
you're looking for, send us an email at mvapich@cse.ohio-state.edu. The
binary mirror url is: http://mvapich.cse.ohio-
state.edu/download/mvapich/spack-mirror/mvapich2x/

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: netcdf-fortran
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the Fortran
distribution.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: serialbox
dependencies.description:
Serialbox is a serialization library and tools for C/C++, Python3 and
Fortran. Serialbox is used in several projects for building validation
frameworks against reference runs.
